column2: Cristo Redentor Statuette
Cristo Redentor Statuette

An intricately-crafted stone replica of the famous Cristo Redentor statue outside the imperial capital of Brazil. Despite its humble appearance, statuettes such as these are rare, and having one is a sign that the Emperor of Brazil has true respect for you.
Tourmaline Amulet
Tourmaline Amulet

This amulet's centerpiece is a blue gemstone. The hue is more intense and dazzling than any other jewel, and it is said that this gem can only be found in a particular region of Brazil. They are rare enough in Brazil, to say nothing of the outside world.
Futebol
Futebol

This black-and-white sphere, known as a "futebol", is said to be the pre-Event version of a common ball. This particular ball has special significance - it was once kicked by the legendary Saint Pelé, and balls of this type cannot be made using today's technology.
Oriental Rug
Oriental Rug

Despite its name, this intricate rug was not made in the eastern parts of Brazil. This style of rug is said to have originated with travelers from across the Atlantic in the days before the Event, and it has since become popular with the Brazilian elite.
Carranca
Carranca

This menacing-looking wooden carving originated as a good luck charm in the Northeast of Brazil, although you cannot imagine how such an artifact could bring comfort to those who saw it. Nevertheless, its powers are said to be quite real...
Brazilian Robes
Brazilian Robes

These robes are noticeable for their deep red hue, made using dye from a paubrasilia tree. This hue, associated as it is with the mighty Brazilian Empire, inspires awe and respect from anyone who sees it.
Silk Shroud
Silk Shroud
Rumored to have belonged to the renowned Fátima, first Empress of Brazil, this masterfully crafted silk shroud shimmers in the light and draws the attention of all who see it.
Brazilian Reliquary
Brazilian Reliquary

This box is said to contain a body part from a famed Brazilian saint, although you have also been instructed not to open this box under any circumstances. However, lightly shaking the box will reveal the claim to be true.
Jungle Knife
Jungle Knife

This absolutely gigantic blade is closer to a sword than it is to a knife. Blades of this exact type were once wielded by the most fearsome pre-Event Brazilian soldiers, and they continue to be used today as both tools and weapons.
Small Figurine
Figurine of [offmap_china.PrevRuler.GetFullName]
A small figurine depicting a former ruler of Brazil. Though small, it has intricate details and shows great craftsmanship.
Berimbau
Berimbau

This bow can be easily mistaken for a weapon at first glance, but it is actually a musical instrument. Though the tunes that can be played on it are simple, they are nonetheless mesmerizing and compelling.
Dragoon Lance
Dragoon Lance

This finely-crafted lance dates to before the Event, and was used by one of the original Independence Dragoons during the great war that established the Brazilian Empire. It has been lovingly maintained through the ages.
Taurus
Taurus

This Taurus, or "Bull", certainly earns its name. A rare example of a pre-Event firearm, this particular example is finely decorated with gold and steel. It is both more powerful and more intimidating than a typical sidearm.
Paubrasilia Sculpture
Paubrasilia Sculpture

This wooden sculpture has been carved entirely out of paubrasilia. Paubrasilia is an incredibly rare and prestigious commodity outside of Brazil, so this sculpture is worth far more than a typical wooden carving.
Painting of Casco da Cintilação
A beautiful Baroque painting of the horse of a former Emperor, a great steed by the name of Casco da Cintilação. It is wearing an elaborately crafted silken gown, making it look most regal.
Coffee Current Tapestry
Tapestry of [tapestry_target.GetName]
A beautiful tapestry depicting a scene from a market on the Coffee Current. Looking at it one can almost hear the jingle of coins and the chattering of a dozen languages.
Grand Brazilian Tapestry
Grand Brazilian Tapestry

A magnificent tapestry showing the splendor of Brazil and its Emperor. It depicts Brazilian armies in a triumphant victory over a barbaric horde, and a grand jaguar - a symbol of imperial authority - looking down at them from a tall tree.
Carta Armor
Carta Armor

This peculiar-looking set of armor was manufactured in a small and isolated pavilion in São Paulo by a secretive group of craftsmen. Despite its odd appearance, it is highly effective at deflecting blows from even the sharpest of swords.
Guerilla Warfare
Guerilla Warfare
This manual on unconventional warfare was originally penned by the legendary warrior Che Guevara. Although most believe he was a Cubano, Brazilians insist that he was born in Gaúcho country.
The Guarani
The Guarani

This book, detailing the life of an ancient feudal lord in the uncharted Brazilian hinterland, is one of the few works of Brazilian literature to survive the Event intact, and remains a compelling tale of adventure and romance.
Brazilian Compendium of Medicine
Brazilian Compendium of Medicine
This beautifully bound book tells of the many fascinating aspects of Brazilian medicine, paying special attention to indigenous medical techniques.
Illustrated Brazilian Action Story
Illustrated Brazilian Action Story

This peculiar-looking book comes from a small neighborhood of São Paulo. This epic chronicle has been meticulously preserved and copied by modern artists. Although it is very much a niche story, it remains somewhat popular.
Peace and Prosperity for Brazil
Peace and Prosperity for Brazil
This in-depth biography of the second Emperor of Brazil, Pedro the Magnanimous, can be somewhat dry at times. Nevertheless, it does inspire thoughts of having a realm as prosperous as his...
Brazilian Economic Chronicle
[offmap_china.Governor.GetFirstName]'s Chronicle of Economic Principle
A beautiful book bound with great care. Its outlining of the general principles of economy and trade seems incredibly insightful.
Exterminate All The Brutes
Exterminate All The Brutes
This book was completed by the warlord Leighley shortly before his death. It provides a gruesome and disturbing look into his psyche.
Brazilian Artwork
This painting showcases the beauty and grandeur of traditional Baroque art.

[Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], agrees with your wise judgment that [chinese_invasion_target.GetFullName] threatens to destabilize the world. The forces of the [From.Offmap.GetFullName] are already marching out of the August Empire.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], has graciously fulfilled your wish. A wondrous artifact of expert [From.Offmap.Ruler.Culture.GetName] craftsmanship will be bestowed upon you for safekeeping.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], has graciously accepted your offer of supplying [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetHerHis] army with magnificent steeds.

The [From.GetTitle] of the [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] addresses a letter to the marauding [Root.GetTitle] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. May your realm crumble under your incompetent rule.\n\nDo be warned that angering the magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName] is most unwise, do not act surprised when our forces come to put an end to your misguided raids.

The magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], has graciously accepted your gift. [person_sent_as_tribute.GetImpressionOfTribute]. \n\nThe generosity of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty will not be forgotten.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe magnanimous [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], has generously granted your request. A royal seal has been delivered denoting the status of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] as a favored state for imperial goods.

[offmap_china.Ruler.GetMediumChineseEmperorName] has closed off the Empire and stopped all trade along the Coffee Current. This is not acceptable. [offmap_china.Ruler.GetSheHeCap] not only harms trade for [offmap_china.GetShortName] but also for my own lands. We must make the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] open up their borders one way or another...
The Coffee Current is already ours, we just need to 'convince' the traders of that fact.

After [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], ordered that the borders be shut and trade along the Coffee Current be halted, [From.GetTitledName] deemed that unacceptable and mobilized [From.GetHerHis] forces to open the Coffee Current by force. The [From.Culture.GetName] troops managed to overcome and defeat the forces of [offmap_china.GetShortName] led by [offmap_china.Governor.GetTitledFirstName].\nThe August [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] is most displeased with this loss and, under pressure by his advisors, has had no choice but to once more open up the Coffee Current to traders.
The Coffee Current is open... but at what cost?

After [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], ordered that the borders be shut and trade along the Coffee Current be halted, [From.GetTitledName] deemed that unacceptable and mobilized [From.GetHerHis] forces to open the Coffee Current by force. However, the [From.Culture.GetName] troops were no match for the forces of [offmap_china.GetShortName] led by [offmap_china.Governor.GetTitledFirstName].\nThe August [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] is most pleased with this victory and maintains the isolation of the [offmap_china.GetFullName].
It seems even a dormant jaguar is a dangerous one...

After [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], ordered that the borders be shut and trade along the Coffee Current be halted, [From.GetTitledName] deemed that unacceptable. Using [From.GetHerHis] vast influence over the wealth of the Coffee Current, [From.GetTitledFirstName], coerced the traders to return to their posts. This influx of traders into the formerly dormant trading posts was felt all the way back in [offmap_china.GetShortName] as they began transporting and selling their goods, much to the anger of the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress].\nWith no way of stopping this surge of trade the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] has had no choice but to officially reopen the Coffee Current.
And now commerce and trade return to the South.
You will force open trade along the Coffee Current much to the anger of §Y[offmap_china.GetFullName]§!.
You will negotiate a deal with §Y[offmap_china.GetFullName]§! to open up trade along the Coffee Current.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\nThe magnanimous [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], demands that, in exchange for opening up the Coffee Current, you [GetChineseForceOpenDemand].\nI am sure you can see how this will benefit both our nations and trust you to make the correct decision.

In exchange for §R50% income§!, §R30% troop reinforcement rate§! and §R[GetChineseOffmapTributaryPrestigeCost]§!, receive §G2 Benevolence per month§! and §Ga Brazilian regiment to raise as the defender in a war§!.\nThese effects last until the end of the Empire's §Yruling dynasty§!, or until §Yyou declare independence§! (through war, or decision in the Intrigue screen).\n

If you are victorious then the §Y[offmap_china.GetFullName]§! will Open its borders and you will be §Gfavored in trade along the Coffee Current§!. However, if you are defeated it will cost you §Rmonthly prestige and benevolence§!.

Once again the Coffee Current has opened! Negotiations for this began between [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], and [From.GetTitledName]. The two managed to come to an agreement in that the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] would order the reopening of trade and all [offmap_china.Ruler.GetSheHe] asked was for [From.GetTitledFirstName] to [From.GetChineseForceOpenDemandChina].\nWhilst the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] may have preferred to stay in isolation, whispers from the South say that even [offmap_china.Ruler.GetHerHis] closest advisors are pleased with this peaceful outcome.

Rumors of the military might of the [offmap_china.GetFullName] is proving to be a forceful diplomatic tool in itself – after what seems like brief negotiations, [chinese_invasion_target.GetBestName] has peacefully agreed to become a tributary state of the August Empire. Their courtiers whisper that they can only hope that the relationship between [chinese_invasion_target.GetTitle] and the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmpressEmperorCap] be a fruitful one.

Not even an independent realm like that of [chinese_invasion_target.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dares stand against the full force of the [offmap_china.GetFullName]. [chinese_invasion_target.GetBestName] has instead peacefully agreed to become a tributary state of the August Empire. Time will tell whether the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmpressEmperorCap] truly favors them.

[From.GetTitledName] has decreed that the fury of heaven shall reign down upon us! The Brazilian armies have begun their march for our lands, and rumors of their military might are already spreading throughout our own regiments. We are soon to face the full wrath of the [From.Offmap.GetFullName].

[From.GetTitledName] has decreed that the fury of heaven shall reign down upon [chinese_invasion_target.GetTitledName]! The Brazilian armies have begun their march, and the [chinese_invasion_target.GetTitle], if not hiding out in [chinese_invasion_target.Capital.GetName], can only hope to stand tall, as [chinese_invasion_target.GetHerHis] borders are attacked with the full wrath of the [From.Offmap.GetFullName].

Recent events in the [the_protector_general.Offmap.GetFullName] have caused various rebel factions to rise up in and around the August Empire. One of them is led by [jurchen_invader.GetFirstName], in charge of a [jurchen_invader.Culture.GetName] tribe, descending upon the North from the jungle. Wherever [jurchen_invader.GetSheHe] goes, the countryside is left ablaze. Throughout the region, people are praying for someone to deal with the hostile raiders...

The recent turmoil in the August Empire has left the old House of [PrevRuler.GetOnlyDynastyName] in chaos – removed from the line of succession, Prince [displaced_prince.GetFirstName] now seeks a new future, north of the [the_protector_general.Offmap.GetFullName]. Rumors say that raiding and looting follow in [displaced_prince.GetHerHis] footsteps...

After the recent civil war in the August Empire was crushed by the forces of the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress], one of the rebels that opposed [offmap_china.Ruler.GetHerHim], [rebel_general.GetTitledFirstName], has fled northwards with his forces. He claims that the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is not fit to rule and that he is the true August [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] and shall establish his own Empire.

Word has reached you from the south that the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetShortChineseEmperorName] has ordered [offmap_china.Governor.GetTitledFirstName] to mobilize [offmap_china.Governor.GetHerHis] forces and to launch an invasion of our lands to try and force their false [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] onto us. There can only be one jaguar and we shall show the [offmap_china.GetShortName] pretender that it is [chinese_invasion_target.GetTitledName].

Word has reached you from the south that the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetShortChineseEmperorName] has ordered [offmap_china.Governor.GetTitledFirstName] to mobilize [offmap_china.Governor.GetHerHis] forces and to launch an invasion of [chinese_invasion_target.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to dismantle the upstart pretender. There can only be one jaguar and [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], is moving to show, by force, that it is [offmap_china.Ruler.GetHerHim].
Only one can claim to be the Lord of the Southern Cross.

After the death of [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has fallen into ruin, with no heir ready to take on the mantle of the August Heir and Lord of the Southern Cross the Empire has collapsed. The vassals relieved as they are now free from the grasps of the [From.GetEmperorEmpress].\nFurther in the south it is reported that [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], is very pleased with this development as they are once again the only jaguar to rule.

After the defeat of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], at the hands of [From.GetTitledFirstName], [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has been dismantled. The vassals relieved as they are now free from the grasps of the [FromFrom.GetTitle].\nFurther in the south it is reported that [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], is very pleased with this as outcome as once again [offmap_china.GetShortName] has displayed the might of the jaguar.

[offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], is no longer the only jaguar to rule. General [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] [From.GetBirthName] has completed [From.GetHerHis] conquest and has crowned [From.GetHerselfHimself] [From.GetTitledName]! [From.GetSheHeCap] claims to be the true August Heir and Lord of the Southern Cross.\nTalk among the traders from the south say that the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetShortChineseEmperorName] is most angered by this pretender. The future of this new [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] remains in question but nobody can argue with results of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s invasion...
And now we bow to a jaguar.
And now they bow to a jaguar.

The forces of [From.GetBestName] have prevailed! With the troops of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] shattered and the conflicts in the August Empire finally over, the former [offmap_china.PrevRuler.GetEmperorEmpress], [offmap_china.PrevRuler.GetOnlyDynastyName] [offmap_china.PrevRuler.GetBirthName], has been dethroned and in [offmap_china.PrevRuler.GetHerHis] place [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], now rules!\nHouse [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] has successfully invaded the Southern lands and now they reign supreme.\nGlory to the new [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress]!
And so rises a new jaguar.

The forces of [From.GetBestName] have been defeated! All across the [offmap_china.GetShortName] heartland they have been crushed in their many skirmishes with the troops of the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress].\nNow the forces in the North, led by [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], have prevailed in their battles as well putting an end to this foolish invasion and dismantling [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] once and for all.
And so the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetOnlyDynastyName] jaguar remains.

Whispers in the South claim that [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], is in a joyous mood today for [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetBestName], the [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetRootRelation] of [From.GetBestName], has died.\n[invasion_of_china_claimant.GetHerHisCap] death has shattered the morale of the [From.Culture.GetName] forces who now retreat back to their homes in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nJust like [invasion_of_china_claimant.GetBestName] this invasion of [offmap_china.GetShortName] has come to an end.
Maybe the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] sent the Men in Black in secret?

I asked the translator to not only instruct me in the proper pronunciation, but also teach me the grammar and meaning behind the words. It took many hours, but the pleased look on [FromFrom.GetJobTitle] [FromFrom.GetDynName]'s [FromFrom.GetFaceDescription] face as I greet [FromFrom.GetHerHim] in flawless Portuguese proves that it was worth the effort.

I had my servant buy an exquisite garb of Brazilian silk with the proper accessories in preparation for [From.GetJobTitle] [From.GetDynName]'s arrival. However, as I welcomed [From.GetHerHim] and [From.GetHerHis] entourage, the sight of my new robe seemed to displease [From.GetHerHim]! Later, the translator told me I wore several attributes exclusive to the [From.Liege.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle]'s family.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetFullName] has decreed that it is in the [offmap_china.GetName]'s interests that a new, vibrant city be established on the trade routes to the North. This would be a feat worthy of favourable trade agreements, as well as [offmap_china.Ruler.GetHerHisCap] personal notice.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetFullName] has been most pleased to notice [trade_competition_city_winner.GetName]'s efforts in the creation of the city of [trade_competition_new_city.GetName]. Your own failure to encourage trade with the North, however, have not gone unnoticed either.

A noble by the name of [escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName] came to court today seeking asylum. [escaped_chinese_noble.GetSheHeCap] claims to have escaped from Brazil after the rest of [escaped_chinese_noble.GetHerHis] family was executed on orders of the Emperor. "Oh great [Root.GetTitle], your merciful nature is known across the land. I implore you to grant me refuge. It would be an untold kindness!"
I dare not anger the jaguar.
You send §Y[escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName]§! away to avoid angering the Brazilian Emperor.

Despite [escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName]'s fears, no emissaries of the Brazilian Emperor came looking for [escaped_chinese_noble.GetHerHim]. "The time has come for me to leave. I will never forget your kindness, please take this as a token of my gratitude."

Soon after writing to the Brazilian Emperor, a very grateful emissary arrived with several guards to escort [escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName] back to the Empire of Brazil. "You can't understand what they'll do to me!" screamed [escaped_chinese_noble.GetFirstName] as [escaped_chinese_noble.GetSheHe] was dragged out.

Soon after writing to the Brazilian Emperor, an emissary arrived with several guards however [escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName] had escaped the night before! Someone must have warned [escaped_chinese_noble.GetHerHim]. All the emissary said before he left was: "The Emperor will be... displeased"

[escaped_chinese_noble.GetFullName] was found dead in [escaped_chinese_noble.GetHerHis] room this morning, strangled to death with a length of the finest Brazilian silk. The killer was nowhere to be found but I'm sure I know who is responsible.

My guards have dragged a Brazilian thief before me. "[chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap] claims to have an audience scheduled with you, my [Root.GetLordLady]", they report. "Please, forgive the ruse", the [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] urges in a heavy accent, voice thick with emotion. "I'm a [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] – any Brazilian court would be ecstatic to have me! Take pity on my soul, [Root.GetMasterMistress]."

A Brazilian healer has taken shelter in a small village outside of [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], supposedly treating people in exchange for food, and successfully so. My courier first thought the [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] a beggar, but rumor has it [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] comes fleeing the current situation in the [offmap_china.GetFullName]. "It would explain [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] ragtag appearance, my [Root.GetLordLady]."
The Brazilian [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] joins your court.\n

The traveling teacher bows before you and says: 'I humbly greet the [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetFirstName] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]! My name is [traveling_teacher.GetFullName], and I come with an offer. For a modest sum I would be willing to impart one of my many skills to your [child_to_be_taught.GetDaughterSon] [child_to_be_taught.GetFirstName], for I am a scholar of both Portuguese classics and surgery!'
column3: Le professeur itinérant s'incline devant vous et dit: « Je vous salue humblement, [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetFirstName] [Root.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_RealmFull][Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] ! Je m'appelle [traveling_teacher.GetFullName], et je viens avec une offre. Pour une modeste somme, je transmettrais une de mes nombreuses compétences à votre [child_to_be_taught.GetDaughterSon] [child_to_be_taught.GetFirstName], puisque je suis un[traveling_teacher.GetNoneE] érudit[traveling_teacher.GetNoneE] des Classiques confucéens et en chirurgie. »
column4: Der reisende Lehrer verbeugt sich vor Euch und sagt "Meine demütigen Grü§e, [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective]e[Root.GetrMale] [Root.GetFirstName] von [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]! Mein Name ist [traveling_teacher.GetFullName] und ich komme mit einem Angebot. Für eine bescheidene Summe wäre ich bereit, [child_to_be_taught.GetEuremEurer] [child_to_be_taught.GetDaughterSon] [child_to_be_taught.GetFirstName] eine meiner Eigenschaften zu vermitteln, denn ich bin ein Gelehrter sowohl der konfuzianischen Klassik als auch der Chirurgie!"
column6: El maestro viajero se postra ante ti y dice: '¡Saludo humildemente al/ala [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetFirstName] del [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]! Me llamo [traveling_teacher.GetFullName] y os traigo una oferta. A cambio de una módica suma tendré el gusto de impartir una de mis muchas habilidades a vuestro/a [child_to_be_taught.GetDaughterSon] [child_to_be_taught.GetFirstName], ¡pues estoy versado en clásicos confucianos y medicina!'

column2: My council informs that the Brazilian [offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitle] has sent significant forces from the heart of the August Empire, to support their outlying regions in the North. Leaning over the war table, I can only hope that my silence instills confidence in my advisors. In my own chest, I feel a mild panic rising.

My council informs that an invasion force from the August Empire has been deployed in Roraima, to support their outlying regions in the North. Leaning over the war table, I can only hope that my silence instills confidence in my advisors. In my own chest, I feel a mild panic rising.
Imperial Brazilian troops have arrived in §YGuyana§!, near the province of §YBoa Vista§!.
The Imperial Brazilian fleet has arrived with troops and a naval fleet, near the province of §YUaca§!.

When the first [the_winner.Culture.GetName] armies clashed against the Brazilian regiments, few anticipated this outcome. While the August Empire put in a valiant effort, it has ended in a sullen retreat, as it is finally clear that the [offmap_china.GetFullName] has lost the war against [the_winner.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. [the_winner.GetTitledFirstName] stands victorious, while agents across the world are wondering what repercussions this will have for the political map we have come to know.
And so the Jaguar recoils...
The Jaguar is not to be toyed with...

When the [offmap_china.GetFullName] sent their armies to occupy territory in [the_defender.PrimaryTitle.GetName], few expected that the war would eventually end in a stalemate. Brazilian troops are unexpectedly returning home, while the administration of [the_defender.GetTitledName] are working tirelessly to calm the people of [the_defender.Capital.GetName], still shaken by the war.
We survived the wrath of the Jaguar...
Not all who face off against the Jaguar live to tell the tale.

Coffee Current profits are halved and Tributary states can use this opportunity to break free - Brazil will not be able to assist them should they be attacked anyway.

Things are slowly returning to normal in the August Empire and the Coffee Current is safe again.

The foreign dynasty has fallen and Brazil is once more ruled by a native Brazilian [FromFrom.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress]. One morning I awake to find that an envoy from the [offmap_china.GetFullName] has arrived and wishes to speak with me. "Greetings to the [GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. [GetChineseLetterBlessing]. I am [From.GetFullName] and I come bearing treasures from the August Empire to barter and trade on behalf of [offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitledFirstName]. Does this matter interest you?"
The [offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitle] is always in need of more monks! Take [chinese_envoy_eunuch_target.GetTitledFirstName].
[chinese_envoy_concubine_target.GetTitledFirstName] will make an excellent nun.
The Journey Begins

The journey to visit the [offmap_china.Ruler.GetEmperorEmpress] of the [offmap_china.GetName] and show my subservience will take months if not even years. I take my farewells to my near and dear and prepare the caravan for departure.
Let us prepare...
A Voyage to Brazil

Because your capital is along the coast, you are able to sail directly to Rio de Janeiro. This is convenient, as sea voyages to Brazil are both quicker and cheaper than overland journeys through the Amazon rainforest.
Let's set sail!
A Trek Through the Amazon

As your capital does not have easy access to the coast, you have decided to make an overland journey to Brazil. Overland journeys to Brazil are long, ardous, and dangerous, not least because you must traverse the Amazon rainforest.
Let's get going!
The Path to Boa Vista

Our caravan has been camped by the roadside the whole day. The sky has been pouring over us with unusually heavy rain. The whole situation has brought my thoughts to the memories of my late [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName].
column3: Notre caravane campe le long des routes toute la journée. Nous subissons de fortes pluies. Toute cette situation m'a amené à penser à feu m[target_relative.GetOnA] [target_relative.GetRootRelation] [target_relative.GetFirstName].
column4: Unsere Karawane hat den ganzen Tag am Stra§enrand verbracht. Der Himmel hat uns mit ungewöhnlich hartem Regen gestraft. Die ganze Situation hat meine Gedanken auf meine[target_relative.GetnMale] verstorbene[target_relative.GetnMale] [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName] gelenkt.
column6: Nuestra caravana lleva todo el día acampada en la cuneta. Está lloviendo con una fuerza inusitada. Esta situación me ha hecho pensar en mi difunto/a [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName].

column2: The unusually heavy rain has not let up, and your caravan has once again stopped along the road - but not by choice. Your team has informed you that many of your wagons have broken down, and that it will take several days before your caravan is ready to travel again.
I have a deck of cards. Let's play!
You gamble with your caravan team. You might win, or you might lose...
I will keep morale up by spinning a good yarn!
You decide to tell some stories to your team during their break. This may increase your diplomacy skill.
It's a good thing I brought my books...
Read a few books, potentially increasing your skills in the process.
I have to do my part. I'll help my team repair the caravan!
Working in the rain may not be good for your health...

It has been a few days since you decided to help your team repair your caravan. The good news is that you're back on the road and the weather appears to be clearing up. The bad news is that you appear to have come down with a case of pneumonia.
I should have taken it easier...

Your caravan has been advancing briskly along the path to Boa Vista. The weather is ideal for a long trek, and you find yourself being stunned by the ever-changing landscape as your trip continues. Surely, this is a good portent for your eventual meeting!
I feel energized!
And yet, I don't feel any better...
Enough gawking - let's keep moving!

Our caravan has been approached by a smooth-faced [brazilian_trader.Culture.GetName] [brazilian_trader.GetManWoman], claiming to be a renowned trader. After finally getting my attention [brazilian_trader.GetSheHe] beckons me over to [brazilian_trader.GetHerHis] own horse, where something is strapped to its saddle. 'Name's [brazilian_trader.GetBestName], my good [Root.GetLordLady]! Might my latest acquisition interest you?'
Ooh, that looks [brazilian_artifact.GetArtifactDescriptor]. Let me take it off your hands!
§Y[brazilian_artifact.GetName]§! is transfered to your Treasury.
You're certainly a charmer... I could use someone like you.
The [brazilian_trader.GetManWoman] eyes you up and down, before shrugging in agreement.\n§Y[brazilian_trader.GetTitledName]§! joins your court.\n
Guards. I'm suddenly in the mood for a gift...
You order your guards to cut down the trader and steal the goods for you.\n
Flattery gets you nowhere, peddler.
You have better things to do.\n

A rider approached the caravan and handed me a letter with the seal of [target_host.GetBestName]. [target_host.GetFirstName] has heard of my travels and invites our party to rest for a while in the warmth of the [target_host.GetCapitalHolding] [target_host.Capital.Capital.GetName].
This could prove to be an opportunity to get even.
You utilize your rival's hospitality to set up a risky murder attempt on them.
A warm bed and a hot meal is most welcome.
Is my old rival prepared to bury the hatchet?
You accept the invitation to the court of [target_host.GetTitledFirstName].
I prefer my tent as accommodation.

A warm hearth and healthy meals has invigorated the whole company, but after enjoying the hospitality of [target_host.GetTitledFirstName] for some days it's now time to get moving on our path towards [offmap_china.GetName] again.

column1: EVTDESCB_plscometobr_12The previous days have certainly been a delight. I never imagined that we could have so many things in common. It's with regret that I bid farewell to [target_host.GetTitledFirstName] when we decide to move on towards our goal of [offmap_china.GetName].

column2: We are presented with a deliciously looking meal when [target_host.GetTitledFirstName] raises [target_host.GetHerHis] chalice to honor us with a toast. Longing for a good drink I take a big gulp before I notice that [target_host.GetFirstName] turns [target_host.GetHerHis] chalice upside down emptying its content on the floor, laughing manically.
Thank you for being an excellent host.
Let's keep in touch.
Thank you but we need to be on our way.
No, you! You...
The room starts spinning and you black out.
Regaining my conciousness I find myself in the ditch to the side of the road. In my pocket I discover a letter with the firmest handwriting reading 'This is your last warning, stay out of here!'.
I have a terrible ache in my whole body.
You turn over and empty your bowels in the ditch.

'Trust is such a delicate thing', I tell my horse galloping away in the dark night, accompanied by the sound of screams and clattering plates while panic ensues behind us. Some of my servants also had to put their life to it for the whole charade to be believable, but that is an acceptable price to pay.

Just as you are about to make your escape into the dead of the night you are apprehended by the Captain of the guard. Sweat started forming on the temples of your head. Any second now.\nThere's the bellowing scream of [target_host.GetTitledFirstName]'s guts exploding. For a split second you notice the shock in the face of the Captain, as someone exclaims that the [target_host.GetTitle] is dead. Then his eyes refocus on you. Without hesitation, the burly man raises his sword and cuts you in half.

During the dinner, [target_host.GetTitledFirstName], exclaims that [target_host.GetSheHe] has a present for you. Seconds later a man with an arrow sticking out of his back is dragged into the room. With fear you immediately recognize the man from your company that you ordered to assassinate [target_host.GetFirstName]. With a finger pointed towards your head [target_host.GetFirstName] shouts 'I sentence you all to die for your treachery!'. From every corner of the room, guards with drawn weapons are closing a circle fast around your band.

column1: EVTOPTA_plscometobr_14[target_host.GetSheHeCap] should have known better than to trust me.

column2: Now we're even!
There is no escape!

As your caravan advances along the road to Boa Vista, you spot what appears to be a corpse lying ahead of you in the road. However, as you continue to approach it, the "corpse" suddenly springs up and starts running towards your cart. Your guards are about to cut the madman down when you order them to stop - he is begging for help in your own tongue! He explains that he, too, was traveling to Brazil, but his caravan met a disasterous fate...
I will give you some gold.
I do not care.
Take as much gold as you need!.
Our wagons have room for one more...
Arrival at Boa Vista

After a long journey through the jungles of Central America, you have finally arrived at Boa Vista, the capital of Roraima and the northernmost outpost of the ancient Brazilian empire. As you stop in the city to gather supplies, you contemplate the journey ahead. From here, you must journey south to the Amazon river, board a ship, and brave the dangers of the vast rainforest until you reach Belém on the Atlantic coast. From there, you can sail freely to Rio de Janeiro.
I must prepare well for my journey.
The Heart of Darkness

As your boat sails down the Amazon river, you are hailed by a passing ship. "Halt!", announces its captain.\n'I am [other_ruler.GetTitledName]. We are currently guarding the Amazon River on behalf of the [offmap_china.GetFullName]... You, my fine [Root.GetLordLady], need to pay the river toll.' The smirk on the [other_ruler.GetManWoman]'s face makes me hesitate.
Welcome to the jungle, I guess...
You and your entourage are let through.\n
We will have none of that.
You hurl a spear at the [other_ruler.GetTitle] before [other_ruler.GetSheHe] has time to finish smirking.\n
I won't give in to idle threats. Guards, my sword – now!

'Aaah, fellow travelers!' a military [other_ruler.GetManWoman] exclaims, emerging alongside a group of soldiers from the dense rainforest surrounding our camp. 'I am [other_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]. We are here to escort my [Root.GetLordLady] to [Root.GetRandomChineseRegion].' [other_ruler.GetSheHeCap] gestures for [Root.GetHerHis] troops to join my entourage for the evening.
Oh, [other_ruler.GetTitledFirstName]! There's... been a change of plans.
While you obviously did not hire these mercenaries, you caravan might benefit from some more military protection.\n
I think you have me confused with someone...
You explain the situation. The mercenaries are disappointed, but soon leave you and your people alone.

A raft containing soliders blocks your ship's path as it sails down the river. 'Please, we have not eaten in months', a tall [other_ruler.GetManWoman] pleads, before paddling towards your ship: 'I am [other_ruler.GetTitledName]. You will let us dine with your people tonight...!
No need for posturing, [other_ruler.GetTitle]. We have enough food for everyone.
§Y[other_ruler.GetTitledName]§! and [other_ruler.GetHerHis] soldiers appreciate your generosity.\n\n
The [offmap_china.GetFullName] clearly does nothing for you... You should work for me!
§Y[other_ruler.GetTitle]§! abandons [other_ruler.GetHerHis] mercenary way of life and joins your court instead.\n\n
We cannot afford to take pity on strangers...!
The mercenaries get out of your way.

After a long day of sailing down the mighty Amazon, you stop to camp along its banks for the night. As your entourage cooks dinner, you suddenly hear something stirring in the jungle behind you. You wheel around to face the disturbance, only to see two bright yellow eyes peering at you from the dense jungle. Their owner suddenly pounces into the clearing, leaving you standing face-to-face with an emaciated jaguar. It clearly thinks you will be its next meal...
Help me!
Your hired mercenaries run to your side.
Your guards scramble to help you slay the beast.

As your boat sails downriver, an arrow suddenly whizzes past your head, narrowly missing you. You look around to spot the person who fired it, only to see one of your guards get hit by a second arrow. As you hit the deck, you hear dozens of other arrows flying overhead, along with an eerie-sounding battle cry. Your ship is being ambushed by Amazonian natives!
Guards! To arms!
You escape uninjured.
You are wounded by a stray arrow.
You are severely wounded by a well-aimed arrow.
One of the arrows strikes true...

A thick mist descends across the great river as your boat continues its journey down the Amazon. Suddenly, you find yourself surrounded by armed soldiers in front of what looks to be a large rubber plantation. Its grandeur and opulence seem to be out of place in the Amazon rainforest. After a tense standoff, the owner of the plantation comes down to greet you. Speaking in a thick Cajun accent, he asks you and your men to stay the night.
It would be rude to refuse such hospitality.

As you have dinner with the plantation's owner, you discuss the purpose of your journey. After learning that you intend to bend the knee to the Brazilian Emperor, your host goes silent, before speaking in a stern voice.\n"You want to go to Brazil and bow to their Emperor? You are a fool. We have lived here for generations. The Amazon is our home, and we know its ways well. The Brazilians think that they rule the South, that they rule the Amazon, but they are wrong! Nobody truly rules the Amazon - except the Amazon itself.\nTheir empire seems stable now, yes, but it is like a house of cards. Just wait and see what happens when someone blows on it. The Brazilian Empire does not have true power, only an illusion of power. You are journeying thousands of miles, risking your own life, to bow to nothing."

Nobody truly rules the Amazon - except the Amazon itself.\nEven now, their so-called Empire is teetering on the edge of collapse. One small push, and the South will be in total chaos. How can they claim ownership of the whole South in their state? You are journeying thousands of miles, risking your own life, to bow to nothing."

Perhaps, if the rulers understand the Amazon, they can hold it, but they know that they can never truly be its master. You are journeying thousands of miles, risking your own life, to bow to nothing."

After learning that you intend to bend the knee to the Brazilian Emperor, your host goes silent, before speaking in a stern voice.\n"You want to go to Brazil and bow to their Emperor? You are a fool. Nobody truly rules the Amazon - except the Amazon itself.\nBrazil is being torn asunder by internal tensions. This war was inevitable - even though they are both Christian, the Charismatic faith is fundamentally incompatible with the Apostolic faith. If the Charismatics win, they will surely try to conquer beyond the Amazon... but they will fail in the end. You are journeying thousands of miles, risking your own life, to bow to nothing."
I never thought of it that way.
What a load of nonsense.

As you turn in for the night, a beautiful woman appears at your door. You had been trading glances with her all throughout dinner, but you never expected anything more. She explains that she is the niece of the plantation's owner, and that she has never left the plantation's grounds in her entire life. She yearns to leave this place, and see what the world is like... and she wants do it while standing at your side.

As you turn in for the night, a handsome man appears at your door. You had been trading glances with him all throughout dinner, but you never expected anything more. He explains that he is the nephew of the plantation's owner, and that he has never left the plantation's grounds in his entire life. He yearns to leave this place, and see what the world is like... and he wants do it while standing at your side.
We shall sail to Brazil together, my love.
Your place is here, with your family.
A Cajun lover joins your court.
You leave the plantation alone.

You suddenly find yourself stricken down with a terrible disesase. Your physicians claim that the Amazon's climate has taken its toll on your body, while more superstituous members of your crew whisper about the curse of the Amazon. No matter the cause, you are now sick, and terribly so. You can only hope that your illness passes quickly.
This jungle will kill me...

As your journey through the Amazon reaches its final stages, you sight a curious structure off the starboard side of your ship. At a distance it appears to be a normal trading outpost. However, after looking closer, you see decapitated shrunken heads on pikes outside the outpost's entrance. You can also see a figure waving to you from the river's shore, beckoning you to come closer...
We should investigate this.
Curiosity killed the cat...
This is a bad idea. We should keep moving.
You leave well enough alone.

You order your crew to stop in front of the outpost, against the better wishes of your skipper. As you alight from your ship, the figure who was waving rushes forward to greet you. He explains that he was part of a trading mission from the Old World that got shipwrecked off the coast of Brazil, and that he was taken in by a man known as "Leighley". The man then rambles for hours about Leighley, claiming that he is a genius and the only worthy ruler of the entire Amazon rainforest. As this foreigner continues to praise Leighley, you begin to suspect that both of them are stark raving mad. Suddenly, the foreigner abruptly goes silent, and asks you: "Would you like to meet Mister Leighley?"
Yes, take me to him.
You go to Leighley of your own free will.
Um... maybe later.
You try to leave the outpost.

As you try to make your way back to your ship, a group of warriors suddenly emerge from the dense jungle around the outpost and completely surround you. One of their number steps in front of you and says, in a halting voice, "Nobody refuses an invitation from Leighley. You go, or you die." As your eyes scan the group, you can see that every last one of them is holding a weapon of some sort. You realize that their threat is quite serious...
My apologies. I will go to him now.
You surrender to Leighley's warriors.
You'll never take me alive!
You try to make a break for it.
Bodyguards! To arms!
You call your bodyguards to assist you in your escape.

It was a close shave, but you somehow managed to make it to your boat without so much as a scratch. As you scramble onto your ship, you order your crew to sail away at full speed. Arrows and spears are thrown at your boat as you leave, but none of them strike their target. As you continue to sail down the Amazon, you sigh in relief. That was way too close.

As you make a mad dash towards your ship, you are struck by an arrow fired by one of the warriors. Your senses are dulled with excitement, however, and you don't realize the full extent of your injury until you make it back onto your ship. As you lay on the floor in agony, your crew hastily sails the ship back down the Amazon river. You were lucky to escape with your life...

You make it back to your ship uninjured, but you can't say the same about your retinue of bodyguards. Most of them lie motionless on the floor, struck down by Leighley's warriors. Those who still live are at the mercy of Leighley now. As you look back on the camp, you can hear the shouts of one of your bodyguards ringing out: "Go on! We just did our jobs!" This moment will haunt you for the rest of your life...
Onwards to Belém.

As you run back towards your ship, you trip over a vine and are rendered helpless in front of Leighley's warriors. The same man who warned you earlier steps forward, apparently deciding whether or not he should execute you on the spot. After a moment, he orders two other warriors to his side and forces you, at spear-point, to walk to Leighley's compound.
This was a bad idea...
You fail to escape from Leighley's warriors, and are forced to meet him.

As you walk into Leighley's room, you at first believe that he must be away - the room is dimly-lit and appears empty. As you begin to sit down and await his arrival, a deep, raspy voice issues forth from the darkness, startling you back to your feet. "So you are our esteemed visitor from the north. Welcome." A pale and surprisingly overweight man steps forth from the darkness. "It is rare for me to receive visitors of your... stature. I invite you to stay with me for a few days, so we may become acquainted with one another." Unnerved, you consider refusing, but Leighley speaks once more: "I remind you that refusing such gracious hospitality is considered... highly rude. I advise you to accept my offer, while I am still in good spirits."

You are frog-marched into Leighley's room by his loyal band of warriors, and the one who had spoken to you earlier announces: "Here he is. He tried to run." You are highly confused. The room appears to be completely empty. Who is he speaking to? However, your question is soon answered as a man, pale and overweight, steps forth from a dark corner of the room. Although he responds to his native lieutenant, he does not break eye contact with you. "Thank you. You may leave him here with me." The native soldiers leave the room immediately, leaving you alone with Leighley. "I would have liked to meet you under different circumstances, but I do not blame you for running. I will explain why I am here in due course. Until then, however, I invite you to stay here. Do not worry about your ship or your men - I will take care of them."
Of course, of course.
You are taken prisoner by Leighley.

During the third night of your captivity with Leighley, you are suddenly awoken in the dead of night. He is standing directly over you. "Before I can explain why I am here, I must explain who I once was. I was born a peasant in the port of Miami. I had talents far greater than anyone else I knew - my parents, my peers, even my liege. I sought to rise above my station, so I stole a ship and sailed for Brazil." His voice sounds bitter. "I wanted to find a new world, an ideal world, where a man's place was determined solely by the combination of their talents and hard work. I thought I would find it in Brazil. I nearly killed myself trying to get there. I was a fool. Brazil was no different from Miami. There could only be one way for me to find this new world. I would have to make it myself."\n He leaves your room, just as suddenly and quietly as he had arrived.
I should get back to sleep...
You remain in captivity.

Leighley once again visits you in the night. "I looked to the example set by history. There have been many peasants like me, and they all rose to greatness in the same way. They forged a new world from the landscape around them, using fire and iron. So I sailed down the Amazon and I used my fire and my iron to forge my world. And my might and talents were recognized. I attracted many followers, both from the natives and from further afield. They still think I will lead them in a grand assault on Manaus one day." He pauses. "I have achieved much in my life. I have taught my philosophy to hundreds of people. I am worshiped by them, but I recently realized something else. I will not be here forever. This world I have built... once I die, it too will collapse. And I want my world to die in the same way it was built - on my terms."
What is he saying?

Almost a week into your captivity, you awake with a start. The door to your quarters - usually kept tightly locked - has been left ajar. In the distance, you can hear what sounds like a group of Amazonian warriors celebrating loudly - they appear to be distracted, at least for the time being. You hesitantly walk out of your room to see if you can still escape. As you walk down the dark corridors, you peek into Leighley's room. His door has also been left ajar, and Leighley's silhouette can be observed hunching over a desk. He appears to be writing something, but stops suddenly, puts the quill down, and breathes in. He seems to be aware of your presence, but, for some reason, he is not confronting you...
Forget Leighley. I need to leave as soon as I can.
You leave Leighley to his fate, and try to sneak past his men.
This ends now.
You enter Leighley's room.

You emerge from the compound to find a large group of Leighley's warriors ritually slaughtering a water buffalo. Slowly and carefully, you weave past their celebration, and find yourself in front of the river. You see your ship moored on the other side, the sailors apparently asleep. How are you supposed to attract their attention? Just after you have this thought, a small rowboat emerges from behind the ship and comes towards you. Your skipper is onboard, and beckons you to come with him. You glance back at the natives, still engaged in their ritual, before climbing aboard the rowboat. Somehow, you managed to escape from Leighley's compound completely unscathed.
Onwards to Belém.

You quickly scramble onboard your ship and command it to sail away as quickly as possible. Your crew doesn't need the instruction - as soon as you are safely aboard, they continue down the river. You can still hear the warriors shouting angrily in the distance, but their cries grow more and more distant as you sail away. You have somehow managed to escape not only alive, but completely uninjured.

As you run towards your ship, an arrow fired by one of the warriors embeds itself into you, but you push on, ignoring the pain. Once you are safely aboard your ship, you examine the wound more closely. It'll definitely leave a mark, but, considering everything you've been through, it's a small price to pay. As you continue down the river and the cries of the natives grow weaker and weaker, you breathe a sigh of relief. The worst is over.

Arrows and spears soar past you as you run towards your ship. As you try to climb onboard, you hear a dull, wet sound, and your vision goes black. You come to in your ship's quarters, surrounded by your crew. They inform you that you were seriously injured, but managed to fall over in the right way - into your ship. Leighley's camp is far gone. You managed to escape with your life, but just barely.
You successfully escape from Leighley.

You emerge from the compound to find a large group of warriors ritually slaughtering a water buffalo. Slowly and carefully, you try to weave past their celebration, only to end up being spotted by one of the warriors. Their celebration stops immediately, and their exuberant cries of joy change seamlessly into aggressive war chants. In the distance, your ship can be seen maneuvering to your side of the riverbank. There's only one thing you can do.
Run!
You make a run for it.

You continue to stare into Leighley's room, expecting him to get up from his chair or say something to you. He does neither. As you slowly step through into the room, you notice a large knife hanging on the wall next to the door. You suddenly realize what you must do, and, automatically, you grab the knife and advance towards Leighley. As you cut him down, you can hear him mutter... something. You aren't sure what. The celebration continues outside as the life slowly fades from Leighley's eyes. You look at his desk, seeing only three things - a quill, an inkpot, and a large, ornate book. Pausing momentarily, you grab Leighley's book before exiting the room.
Goodbye, Leighley.

As you walk outside of the compound, carrying Leighley's bloodstained knife in one hand and his book in your other, you see what the warriors were doing - they were ritually slaughtering a water buffalo. As you step forward into the light, the warriors suddenly stop celebrating, and instead stare at you, transfixed. After a few moments, one of them bows to you, and he is soon followed by the entire rest of the group. You stumble, blindly, towards the shore, and see your ship waiting for you. Silently, without looking back, you climb aboard. Your ship sails onward, yet further into the rainforest. You will be in civilization soon... at least, in a certain sense of the word.
The horror...
...the horror.
Arrival at Belém

After a long, dangerous trek through the Amazon rainforest, you finally dock at Belém. As you sail towards the city, you suddenly understand why so many call this city the pearl of the Amazon Delta - after weeks spent in the middle of the jungle, a bustling metropolis like this is a sight for sore eyes. As you ready yourself for the journey ahead, you reflect on your recent travels. You successfully braved the mighty Amazon, and are now just a short voyage away from Rio de Janeiro.
Let's not waste any time!
Across the Sea

As the days drag on, I find myself thinking back to [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], wondering what is happening in the [Root.GetCapitalHolding]. And how is [person_missed.GetTitledFirstName] faring, without me there? When can I return home to [person_missed.GetHerHim], when my journey to the August Empire never seems to end?
I need to write a letter to my dear [person_missed.GetFirstName].

Today is an unusually calm day on the South Atlantic. You are just beginning to get bored when a lookout on your top mast spots an incoming ship. At first, you think nothing of it - it's probably just a passing merchant ship, or perhaps it's carrying someone of importance from Brazil. However, as it grows closer, you notice two very important things: they are flying a black flag and appear to be firing at your ship. You are being attacked by pirates!
Everyone, to arms!
Those mangy dogs! They'll stop firing once they see my flag!
defeating the pirates without injury.
receiving minor wounds from the pirates.
being severely injured by the pirates.
being killed by the pirates!

You have been at sea for a while now, and your food supplies are running thin. You have been eating nothing but hardtack for days on end. Some of your crew members warn that this may be bad for your health, but what else are you to do?
Once I'm off this boat, I'll never eat hardtack again...

As you stand on the deck of your ship and survey the endless sea, you notice something odd in the distance. Looking closely, it appears to be a gigantic dorsal fin, and it's headed straight for your ship. Before you can say anything, your lookout raises the alarm: "Shark! Shark! Dead ahead! All hands on deck!" The fin's owner collides with your ship, sending one man overboard. The sea is stained red with his blood...
Kill the beast before it does any more damage!
Your men kill the shark swiftly.
You are accidentally wounded as your men kill the shark.
Both you and your ship are severely damaged before the shark can be killed.
You yourself are thrown overboard...
Smile, you son of a...!
You kill the shark personally.

In recent days, you have seen dark storm clouds gathering on the horizon, stretching in each direction as far as the eye can see. Your men battened down the hatches and prepared themselves for the coming storm, but nothing could prepare you for it. The storm howls and rages without end, and the waves grow higher and higher...
All hands on deck!
Every man for himself!
You make it through the storm miraculously unscathed.
The storm injured you and damages your ship.
The storm nearly destroys both you and your ship.
Your ship cannot survive the onslaught...

As your ship continues its voyage to Rio, your lookout announces something startling. "There is a man hanging to a piece of driftwood towards port!" You and your men quickly assemble along the deck to see if what the lookout says is true. Sure enough, in the distance, you can see a dark mass. One of your men turns to you and asks, "What are your orders?"
What? We aren't going to pick him up!
Bring him aboard, we'll leave him at Rio.
That poor soul... he deserves a place in my court!
The Empire of Brazil

Our company has finally reached the great capital of [offmap_china.GetFullName] - Rio de Janeiro. This is by far the grandest imperial capital you have ever seen. The sky is clear, the streets are clean, and the people are friendly. If you didn't know better, you could almost believe that this place had escaped the Event entirely. Surely, the city's character has been like this since time immemorial...
Let us walk lest I forget about the reason for the journey.

I'm out on a walk in a beautiful park in the August Empire when I spot two groups of people running across a nearby field and kicking a ball around. As you look further, you they are playing Futebol! Brazilians are said to be the best in the world at this game, but these players look decidedly amateur...
I can see an opening in their defense...
'How do you play this game?'
I'll just enjoy the park instead.

Having reached the glorious capital of the [offmap_china.GetFullName], it only takes a few days before a group of ministers approach me, offering to read and discuss the writings of José Bonifácio de Andrada. He was the most prominent advisor of the first Emperor, and was the tutor of the legendary Pedro II of Brazil. They think I, as a ruler, will be particularly interested by his works on politics.
Of course! I would love to hear more about your political philosophy.
The ministers are impressed by your enthusiasm.\n
Ah, I know Bonifácio from his poetry.
The ministers are surprised by how cultured you are.\n
I'm already familiar with Bonifácio's political works.\n
The ministers are impressed by your knowledge.\n
Nonsense! I want to look around the palace – perhaps a tour?
The ministers see to that you are accompanied through the public areas of the capital.\n

My guards and I have been making our way through a bustling market this morning. There is ample supply of every meat and game, and trinkets and baubles abound...! Here and there we encounter soldiers, along with dignitaries from other foreign courts. There is clearly no shortage of business for these traders.
Mmmh, what is that smell...?
You eagerly partake in the local delicacies.\n
I am here to trade! You there, let's talk business.
You offer you patronage to the local traders, allowing you to bring home a §YBrazilian artifact§!...!\n
Guards... You keep that trader occupied...
You proceed to steal from one of the local traders, allowing you to bring home a §YBrazilian artifact§!...!\n
I think I've had enough for one day.

The [Root.GetName] is experiencing a period of internal stability, and trade with the South is profitable. Without any large-scale disasters or powerful enemies prosperity is able to spread, and the military might of Brazil stands ready to defend both its own wealth and its loyal tributaries.

Civil unrest runs rampant in the [Root.GetName], and it has thrown the trade routes with the South into disarray. Brazil's armies are occupied internally in an attempt to keep the peace, and unless the unrest is quelled soon a full-blown civil war may well erupt at any moment.

Civil war has erupted in the [Root.GetName], and trade with the South suffers as a result. The Empire's armies are arrayed against one another, and the ruling dynasty itself is threatened. Intrepid generals may well seek their fortune in the North, beyond Brazil's borders.

A terrible disease wracks the [Root.GetName], leaving thousands lying dead in its wake. Trade has ground to a halt as the Brazilian economy has been forced to its knees, and even the Empire's armies have been decimated to but a shadow of their former glory.

The [Root.GetName] has reached untold power and wealth. As Brazil flourishes, the trade routes with the South bring not only valuable goods in previously unheard-of quantities, but also rich and abundant examples of Brazilian culture. An Emperor of Brazil in this Golden Age may well rightfully consider [Root.Ruler.GetHerselfHimself] the [Root.Ruler.GetMasterMistress] of the Americas.
Brazil is currently open to trade and interested in acquiring friends and tributaries within its sphere of influence.
Brazil has turned inward and is mostly ignoring its gringo neighbors. All actions to gain the Emperor's Benevolence or request boons are invalid. New Tributary states will likely not be accepted.
The Emperor is showing a rare interest in the rest of the world. Brazil might aggressively seek to gain new Tributary states, or even stage a major invasion to 'pacify the North'.
Being Invaded by the Amazonians

The Amazonian warbands of the north pour into Brazil. The mighty Brazilian armies are occupied with their desperate defense of the Empire, and the fighting has greatly disrupted trade as well as caused a mass exodus of refugees. Scions of the current dynasty may well flee northward via sea routes if the war goes poorly enough.
Being Invaded by Gaúchos

An enormous horde of Gaúcho horse warriors has descended upon Brazil from the cold and unforgiving far South. The mighty Brazilian armies are preoccupied with a desperate defense against the fierce invaders. The war is disrupting trade along the Coffee Current and could cause a mass exodus of refugees. Should the Gaúchos triumph, it is possible that scions of the current Dynasty may flee northward with the remnants of their forces.
Candomble Uprising

A religious uprising has erupted in the [Root.GetName], and trade with the South suffers as a result. The entire Northeast has risen against Imperial rule, and the ruling dynasty is in danger. Interpid generals may well seek their fortune in the North, beyond Brazil's borders.
